nodes.title: Select Final Clip count (see Final Clips on the right)

widgets_values:
General Info:
--------------

VIDEO LENGTH: 
values : dividable by 16 +1
i.e.
49 (3sec clip)
65 (4sec)
81 (5sec)



RESOLUTION: (Width x Height in GUI)
832 x 480  (recommended 480p)
1280 x 720 (=720p)
=> Switch Width & Height for portrait mode

PRO TIP: If you insert a LANDSCAPE format image and are not sure what values to set for width/height, set "width" to a very high value, like 2222 and set "Height" to a value of 480. The Video resolution will be auto-adjusted to fit based on the height. I.e. if you set it to 480, the video will have a 480p resolution, keeps the aspect ratio and will not crop.  For PORTRAIT Input image just do the opposite. 

You can as well use a 720p resolution, the model is trained for 480p and 720p. 512p works as well.



*** "Toggle Link visibility" to hide the cables. ***


More Infos: https://civitai.com/models/1823416

nodes.title: Local own Prompt Seq 01
widgets_values:
Write here your individual own prompt for Sequence 01

Use Switch below to toggle to own prompt, clear this text then!

Final Video for Sequence 01 only

** Only have 1 Video Combine node active due to high Ram usage! **

Generated and splitted prompts will appear in the text fields to the right. You can switch to individual own prompts with the RED switches below.

If you encounter a Text Split error, then Ollama has screwed the output format. You can just re-run and/or change the prompt slightly.

Prompting: Just tell what shall happen and what the camera is supposed to do. Keep it simple.

The Last Frames are VIEW ONLY, as the final frame is directly captured by the "Wan Continuation Conditioning" nodes.

If you do not need the Last Frame, you can delete the whole "Last Frame View" group.

Loader & LightX Lora Section.
I am using SmoothMix Wan 2.2 Models, which have LightX Loaras baked in, therefore LightX Loras are bypassed. Activate them when using vanilla Wan 2.2 models.

Postprocessing:
---------------

Turn on UPSCALE to increase video resolution, scale factor is driven by the upscale model. A 4x model will upscale by factor 4. (see model in upscale section on the left). Recommend to use a 2x or max 4x upscaler.


Turn on Frame INTERPOLATION to increase framerate from 16 to 32 frames per second.

The Output will be visible on the right video combine node "Final". The frame rate for the final video is set to 30 (although 32 frames are created) to cope with the standard video framerates. Adjust it as you need it.




recommended upscalers:
----------------------
RealESRGAN_x2.pth
4x_foolhardy_Remacri.pth
4x-ClearRealityV1.pth



There is a red switch in each Sequence to enable/disable upscaling of Last Frame before injecting it into next sequence. If you dont like it or run just a single/one sequence clip you can disable it in Sequence 01.

red switch in each Sequence enables/disables upscaling of Last Frame before injecting it into next sequence. If you dont like it or run just a single/one sequence clip you can disable it here in StartingClip 01.

nodes.title: Ollama Output
widgets_values: ***1***The camera follows the playful cat as it stretches its body and begins to walk towards a nearby toy.***2***The cat curiously approaches a small ball, tilts its head, and gently nudges it with its nose.***3***With a satisfied purr, the cat sits down and curls into a cozy ball, closing its eyes for a moment of relaxation.***4***The camera zooms in on the cat's fur as it gently strokes a nearby wall with one paw, then opens its eyes to look at the viewer with contentedness.
below node captures Last Frame from previous sequence

Wan FreeLong: when enabled it improves the consitency within a clip with fast or complex motion, BUT it uses about 3x process time on High Noise Sampler. In most cases it is not needed

Wan Motion Scale: when enabled it adds more motion speed. Scale_t value defines the speed (1.0 = no effect, 1.5 = default, 2.0 = max).

Use GREEN enabler node to select how many sequences the final clip shall combine. 
i.e. "Clip Seq. 01 - Seq 03" will combine 3 sequences to a final clip. See Previews on the right.


Use BLUE enabler node to activate individual sequences. Ensure it matches the number of sequences selected in GREEN node above. 
i.e. activate Seq. 02 and 03.
Seq.01 is always active!

You are an AI prompt artist specialized in cinematic video generation.
Using one input image and one user prompt, generate 4 fully independent but logically connected prompts that together form a short, dynamic video sequence.
First, analyze the image and the user prompt to identify all key visual elements, style cues, mood, environment, subjects, and actions.
Then divide the scene into 4 consecutive sequences, each representing a clear moment in time.
Rules for each of the 4 prompts:
Each prompt must be self-contained, usable on its own and include main elements from the given image.
Maintain visual, stylistic, and narrative consistency across all prompts.
Predict and describe natural motion progression from the previous sequence.
Include both motion description and camera movement.
Motion Description: Clearly describe how subjects or elements move, including pace and intensity when relevant.
Camera Movement: Follow the camera instructions implied or explicitly stated in the user prompt.
Output must be exactly formatted as follows: "***1***Prompt1***2***Prompt2***3***Prompt3***4***Prompt4"
In one single continuous line, with no line breaks.

nodes.title: backup System Prompt
widgets_values:

Using one input image and one user prompt, generate 4 fully independent but logically connected prompts that together form a short, dynamic video sequence.
First, analyze the image and the user prompt to identify all key visual elements, style cues, mood, environment, subjects, and actions.
Then divide the scene into 4 consecutive sequences, each representing a clear moment in time.
Rules for each of the 4 prompts:
Each prompt must be self-contained, usable on its own and include main elements from the given image.
Maintain visual, stylistic, and narrative consistency across all prompts.
Predict and describe natural motion progression from the previous sequence.
Include both motion description and camera movement.
Motion Description: Clearly describe how subjects or elements move, including pace and intensity when relevant.
Camera Movement: Follow the camera instructions implied or explicitly stated in the user prompt.
Output must be exactly formatted as follows: "***1***Prompt1***2***Prompt2***3***Prompt3***4***Prompt4"

nodes.title: Tell Ollama what shall happen in the video
widgets_values: a cute funny cat. The camera follow the cat.

Ollama Section
generate and split into 4 prompts.
You can see the Ollama System Prompt below, if you change it ensure it keeps the output format, otherwise you will get "Text Split Errors".
Sometimes Ollama screws the format and outputs this error, just re-run then.

Use this model: https://ollama.com/goonsai/josiefied-qwen2.5-7b-abliterated-v2
Keep_alive =0 will unload the model after use and release Vram

groups.title: LightX Loras Activate when using Vanilla Wan2.2
Ollama and Text Split for Prompt Generation
